content.webTitle: Factory work Exhibition throws new light on Warhol

fields.headline: Exhibition throws new light on Warhol
fields.bodyText: His images of Campbell's Soup cans and Marilyn Monroe have endured for more than 15 minutes of fame, but a new exhibition aims to reveal much more about Andy Warhol. Andy Warhol: Other Voices, Other Rooms opens at the Hayward Gallery in London tomorrow and features many of his lesser-known works. The show brings together all 42 of his television programmes for the first time, his rarely seen Factory Diaries and paintings worth £70m. Visitors can also hear cassette recordings he made of life around his studio, the Factory. The exhibition runs until January 18.
